summary: Introduced in the House of Representatives by Rep. Burlison and several cosponsors, H.R. 221 is titled the "Abolish the ATF Act." This concise bill proposes the complete abolishment of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF), a federal law enforcement agency within the Department of Justice. The legislation contains only two operative sections: its short title and a single sentence declaring that the agency is abolished. The bill does not specify any plan for the transfer of the ATF's current regulatory and enforcement duties regarding firearms, explosives, alcohol, and tobacco.
